pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū varaseyyāyo palibundhenti, therā bhikkhū vuṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six had taken possession of the best sleeping places. When the the senior monks evicted them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.4.pli: “kena nu kho mayaṃ upāyena idheva vassaṃ vaseyyāmā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.4.eng: “How can we get to stay here during the rainy season?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.5.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū there bhikkhū anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.5.eng: They then arranged their sleeping places so as to encroach on the senior monks, thinking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū there bhikkhū anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.8.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six arrange their sleeping places so as to encroach on the senior monks?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.9.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, there bhikkhū anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, there bhikkhū anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.13.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre jānaṃ pubbupagataṃ bhikkhuṃ anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeyya— yassa sambādho bhavissati so pakkamissatī’ti, etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.16.1.eng: ‘If, in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, a monk arranges his sleeping place in a way that encroaches on a monk that he knows arrived there before him, with the intention that anyone who feels crowded will leave, and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.4.eng: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.5.eng: A dwelling belonging to the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.6.eng: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.8.pli: vuḍḍhoti jānāti, gilānoti jānāti, saṅghena dinnoti jānāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.8.eng: he knows that he is senior, he knows that he is sick, he knows that it was given to him by the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.12.pli: mañcassa vā pīṭhassa vā pavisantassa vā nikkhamantassa vā upacāre seyyaṃ santharati vā santharāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.12.eng: if he puts out his sleeping place at the access to the bed, the bench, the entrance, or the exit, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.13.pli: Abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.13.eng: If he sits down or lies down on it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.14.eng: He does so only for this reason and no other:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.15.pli: na añño koci paccayo hoti anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.15.eng: there is no other reason for arranging his sleeping place in a way that encroaches.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.1.pli: Saṅghike saṅghikasaññī anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.1.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, and he perceives it as such, and he arranges his sleeping place there in a way that encroaches, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.2.pli: Saṅghike vematiko anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.2.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and he arranges his sleeping place there in a way that encroaches, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.3.pli: Saṅghike puggalikasaññī anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.3.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he perceives it as belonging to an individual, and he arranges his sleeping place there in a way that encroaches, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.4.pli: Mañcassa vā pīṭhassa vā pavisantassa vā nikkhamantassa vā upacāraṃ ṭhapetvā seyyaṃ santharati vā santharāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.4.eng: If he puts out his sleeping place, or has it put out, anywhere apart from the access to the bed, the bench, the entrance, or the exit, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.5.pli: Abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.5.eng: If he sits down or lies down on it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.6.pli: Vihārassa upacāre vā upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ vā maṇḍape vā rukkhamūle vā ajjhokāse vā seyyaṃ santharati vā santharāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.6.eng: If he puts out his sleeping place, or has it put out, in the vicinity of a dwelling, in an assembly hall, under a roof cover, at the foot of a tree, or out in the open, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.7.pli: Abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.7.eng: If he sits down or lies down on it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.8.eng: If it belongs to an individual, but he perceives it as belonging to the Sangha, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.9.eng: If it belongs to an individual, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.10.pli: Puggalike puggalikasaññī aññassa puggalike āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.10.eng: If it belongs to an individual, and he perceives it as such, but that individual is not himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.11.eng: If it belongs to himself, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.3.2.eng: if he enters because he is sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.3.3.pli: sītena vā uṇhena vā pīḷito pavisati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.3.3.eng: if he enters because he is feeling cold or hot;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.3.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.3.7.eng: The training rule on encroaching, the sixth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:0.5.eng: 17. The training rule on throwing out

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū aññataraṃ paccantimaṃ mahāvihāraṃ paṭisaṅkharonti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of seventeen were repairing a large dwelling nearby,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.3.eng: intending to stay there for the rainy season.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.4.pli: Addasaṃsu kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sattarasavaggiye bhikkhū vihāraṃ paṭisaṅkharonte.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.4.eng: The monks from the group of six saw this

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.6.eng: “These monks from the group of seventeen are repairing a dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.9.eng: “Let’s wait until they’ve finished repairing it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.10.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sattarasavaggiye bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.10.eng: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six said to those from the group of seventeen,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.12.eng: “Shouldn’t you have told us beforehand? We would’ve repaired another one.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.13.eng: “Doesn’t this dwelling belong to the Sangha?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.15.eng: “Well then, leave! This dwelling is ours.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.17.eng: You can stay here and so can we.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.18.pli: “Uṭṭhethāvuso, amhākaṃ vihāro pāpuṇātī”ti kupitā anattamanā gīvāyaṃ gahetvā nikkaḍḍhanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.18.eng: But they said, “Leave, this dwelling is ours,” and they grabbed them by the necks and threw them out in anger.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.19.eng: The monks from the group of seventeen cried.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.20.eng: When other monks asked them why,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.21.pli: “Ime, āvuso, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā amhe saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍhantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.21.eng: they told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.22.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.22.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.23.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā bhikkhū saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍhissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.23.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six angrily throw other monks out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.24.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.24.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.25.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, kupitā anattamanā bhikkhū saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍhathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.25.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.28.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, kupitā anattamanā bhikkhū saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍhissatha?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.28.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.30.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.30.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.31.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ kupito anattamano saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍheyya vā nikkaḍḍhāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:1.31.1.eng: ‘If a monk, in anger, throws a monk out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, or has him thrown out, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.4.eng: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.9.eng: A dwelling belonging to the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.10.eng: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.12.pli: gabbhe gahetvā pamukhaṃ nikkaḍḍhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.12.eng: if he takes hold of him in a room and throws him out to the entryway, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.13.pli: Pamukhe gahetvā bahi nikkaḍḍhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.13.eng: If he takes hold of him in the entryway and throws him outside, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.14.pli: Ekena payogena bahukepi dvāre atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.14.eng: Even if he makes him go through many doors with a single effort, he commits one offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.16.eng: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.17.pli: Sakiṃ āṇatto bahukepi dvāre atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.1.17.eng: If he only asks once, then even if the other makes him go through many doors, he commits one offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.1.pli: Saṅghike saṅghikasaññī kupito anattamano nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.1.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, and he perceives it as such, and in anger he throws him out, or has him thrown out, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.2.pli: Saṅghike vematiko kupito anattamano nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.2.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and in anger he throws him out, or has him thrown out, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.3.pli: Saṅghike puggalikasaññī kupito anattamano nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.3.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he perceives it as belonging to an individual, and in anger he throws him out, or has him thrown out, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.4.pli: Tassa parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.4.eng: If he throws out one of his requisites, or he has it thrown out, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.5.pli: Vihārassa upacārā vā upaṭṭhānasālāya vā maṇḍapā vā rukkhamūlā vā ajjhokāsā vā nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.5.eng: If he throws him out, or has him thrown out, from the vicinity of a dwelling, from an assembly hall, from under a roof cover, from the foot of a tree, or from a space out in the open, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.6.pli: Tassa parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.6.eng: If he throws out one of his requisites from any of these places, or he has it thrown out, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.7.pli: Anupasampannaṃ vihārā vā vihārassa upacārā vā upaṭṭhānasālāya vā maṇḍapā vā rukkhamūlā vā ajjhokāsā vā nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.7.eng: If he throws out one who is not fully ordained, or has them thrown out, from a dwelling, from the vicinity of a dwelling, from an assembly hall, from under a roof cover, from the foot of a tree, or from a space out in the open, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.8.pli: Tassa parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.8.eng: If he throws out one of their requisites from any of these places, or has it thrown out, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.9.eng: If it belongs to an individual, but he perceives it as belonging to the Sangha, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.10.eng: If it belongs to an individual, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.11.pli: Puggalike puggalikasaññī aññassa puggalike āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.11.eng: If it belongs to an individual, and he perceives it as such, but that individual is not himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.2.12.eng: If it belongs to himself, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.2.eng: if he throws out one who is shameless, or has him thrown out;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.3.pli: tassa parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.3.eng: if he throws out one of the requisites belonging to that person, or has them thrown out;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.4.eng: if he throws out one who is insane, or has him thrown out;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.5.pli: tassa parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.5.eng: if he throws out one of the requisites belonging to that person, or has them thrown out;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.6.pli: bhaṇḍanakārakaṃ kalahakārakaṃ vivādakārakaṃ bhassakārakaṃ saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakaṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.6.eng: if he throws out one who is quarrelsome and argumentative, who creates legal issues in the Sangha, or has them thrown out;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.7.pli: tassa parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.7.eng: if he throws out one of the requisites belonging to that person, or has them thrown out;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.8.pli: antevāsikaṃ vā saddhivihārikaṃ vā na sammā vattantaṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.8.eng: if he throws out a pupil or student who is not conducting himself properly, or has him thrown out;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.9.pli: tassa parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.9.eng: if he throws out one of the requisites belonging to such a person, or has them thrown out;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.11.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc17:2.3.12.eng: The training rule on throwing out, the seventh, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:0.5.eng: 18. The training rule on upper stories

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā eko heṭṭhā viharati, eko upari.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.2.eng: At that time two monks were staying in a dwelling with an upper story belonging to the Sangha, one staying below and one above.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.3.pli: Uparimo bhikkhu āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ sahasā abhinisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.3.eng: The monk above sat down hastily on a bed with detachable legs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.4.pli: Mañcapādo nippatitvā heṭṭhimassa bhikkhuno matthake avatthāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.4.eng: A leg fell off and hit the monk below on the head.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.8.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.8.eng: and he told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.9.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.9.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ sahasā abhinisīdissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.10.eng: “How could a monk sit down hastily on a bed with detachable legs on an upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.11.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.11.eng: After rebuking that monk in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ sahasā abhinisīdasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.12.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ sahasā abhinisīdissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.15.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.17.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.17.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.18.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.18.1.eng: ‘If a monk sits down or lies down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on an upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:1.18.1.comm: I am here taking kuṭi to refer to the upper story itself, rather than the whole building, which already has the separate name vihāra.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.4.eng: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.5.eng: A dwelling belonging to the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.6.eng: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.8.eng: a man of average height does not hit his head.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.10.eng: it stands after inserting the limbs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.12.eng: it stands after inserting the limbs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.14.eng: if he sits down on it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.1.16.eng: if he lies down on it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.1.pli: Saṅghike saṅghikasaññī uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.1.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, and he perceives it as such, and he sits down or lies down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on an upper story, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.2.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he is unsure of it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.3.pli: saṅghike puggalikasaññī uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.3.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he perceives it as belonging to an individual, and he sits down or lies down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on an upper story, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.4.eng: If it belongs to an individual, but he perceives it as belonging to the Sangha, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.5.eng: If it belongs to an individual, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.6.pli: Puggalike puggalikasaññī aññassa puggalike, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.6.eng: If it belongs to an individual, and he perceives it as such, but that individual is not himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.2.7.eng: If it belongs to himself, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.2.eng: if there is no upper story;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.3.eng: if the upper story is so low that one hits the head;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.4.eng: if the lower story is not in use;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.5.eng: if the upper story has floorboards;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.6.eng: if the legs are fastened by bolts;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.7.pli: tasmiṃ ṭhito gaṇhati vā laggeti vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.7.eng: if he stands on it to get hold of something or to put something up;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.7.comm: Sp 2.133: Tasmiṁ ṭhitoti āhaccapādake mañce vā pīṭhe vā ṭhito upari nāgadantakādīsu laggitakaṁ cīvaraṁ vā kiñci vā gaṇhāti vā, aññaṁ vā laggeti, tassāpi anāpatti, “Tasmiṁ ṭhito: standing on the bed or bench with detachable legs, he takes hold of a robe or anything else hanging from a wall peg, etc., above, or he puts something up; for this too there is no offense.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc18:2.3.10.eng: The training rule on upper stories, the eighth, is finished.
